rComments: If this man taught at the national war college then being in his class was an honor. This is one of those classes that would have been worth it even if I failed. Fascinating person to see teaching.

Clarke expects a level of dedication that is beyond UCSC. He teaches for people that truly love the subject. If you don't love this you shouldn't be here. I got lucky that I had an excellent TA. It would have been awful if the entire grade had been up to Clarke alone.

I had a horrible time in this class. It is really hard to understand what he says during lecture, the worst part is there are no e-commons or  power points to try to follow. The final is an unknown topic all we know is we must know ALL of the readings and lecture notes there are no guidelines and is an in class exam. Good luck you will need it.

Clarke probably knows more about US Foreign Policy than anybody should.  No, the class isn't easy, but if you are sick of not getting your money's worth out of Santa Cruz, then this class is for you.  I came away from the class with a good sense of how foreign policy is made in this crazy nation...and a wheelbarrow full of books.

One of the best professors that I have ever had. Also a very difficult one. His lectures were great. You had to pay constant attention to do well, and that included staying on top of the readings. If you like a challenge, take this class. If you don't, but are interested in foreign policy, i'd take advantage and take his course. Very knowledgable.

He spends most of the time telling personal stories about the other teaching and government jobs he's held.  The rest of the time he's listing off facts that you have to hurry to take down and hope you'll remember.  Tests were so vague!  He is a difficult grader and focuses too much on writing style rather than content.  Avoid him!

This class had an insane amount of reading. The professor spent the first half listing each of the agencies in the US government like the state department and who was in them. Then the second half was his personal crusade against Israel. Don't take this class.
